Description: Study of an ancient Egyptian limestone statue of a seated male and female couple from the 18th Dynasty (EA 36), seen slightly from the side and seated upon a chair with lion's paw feet; female figure wears a diaphanous dress and gala-wig; male figure wears a pleated tunic with short flared sleeves and a curled lappet-wig. c.1855-65 Graphite
Curator's comments: See 2002-10-26-8 for a general discussion of the album. These drawings are from an album which originally contained 79 sheets of studies of Egyptian and Assyrian antiquities, along with studies from nature. The geese are based on an Egyptian wall painting of a goose census from a tomb of c. 1350 BC and the statue of an Egyptian couple is from the 18th Dynasty. The album was sold at Christie's, London in 2000 and later split up.
Exhibition history: 2007, 28 June-11 November, BM, room 90, 'Prints and Drawings: Recent Acquisitions'
Funder name: Funded by: Friends of Prints and Drawings
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Anonymous (Christie's London 8.vi.2000/31 bought Campbell Wilson)
Acquisition notes: This item has an uncertain or incomplete provenance for the years 1933-45. The British Museum welcomes information and assistance in the investigation and clarification of the provenance of all works during that era. From the same album as 2002-10-26-8 and 2003-4-29-2, 3, 5, 6, 7 & 11.
